duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide care to patients on an assigned nursing unit under the direction of a Registered Nurse.
Communicate effectively with patients, families, visitors, and members of the healthcare team in a respectful manner.
Assist with patient hygiene, meeting elimination needs, and providing for nutritional needs of the patient.
Assist with ambulating, range of motion, and rounding with assigned patients.
Follow policies and procedures related to patient and staff safety and adhere to confidentiality standards.
Accurately document vital sign monitoring and results in the patient’s electronic medical record.
Proactively organize and stock nursing unit with patient care supplies.
Empty, measure, and record output in all Foley bags/colostomy bags as directed by the RN and at the end of the assigned shift.
Perform rounding and repositioning with assigned patients every two hours.
Assist nurses in admitting patients and provide hand-off report to oncoming CNA before leaving at the end of the shift.

education_certification.credential: Certified Nursing Assistant through the State of Illinois
Current Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) certification from the American Heart Association
